subject: Automobile Racing
organizations: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing
lead_paragraph: The cars of the defending Nascar champion Jimmie Johnson and the series points leader Jeff Gordon failed inspection yesterday at Infineon Raceway in Sonoma, Calif. Each driver was barred from all activity, including qualifying. Nascar said the No. 24 and No. 48 Chevrolets, both owned by Hendrick Motorsports, had modifications to the front fenders that were deemed illegal during morning inspection. The Hendrick crews will be allowed to fix them and they can race in tomorrow’s Toyota/Save Mart 350, although they will have to start from the rear of the 43-car field. Gordon is the defending race winner.
